import smtplib
from email.mime.text import MIMEText

TEMPLATE = """%s

This mail send from a Python robot.
If any question, email to xjh_cn@yeah.net.
"""


def send(to_list, sub, content, 
        mail_host="smtp.163.com", mail_user="robot_2018", mail_pass="robot2018",
        mail_postfix="163.com", template=TEMPLATE):
    me = "alice" + "<" + mail_user + "@" + mail_postfix + ">"
    msg = MIMEText(template % content, _subtype='plain')
    msg['Subject'], msg['From'], msg['To'] = sub, me, ";".join(to_list)
    try:
        server = smtplib.SMTP()
        server.connect(mail_host)
        server.login(mail_user, mail_pass)
        server.sendmail(me, to_list, msg.as_string())
        server.close()
        return True
    except Exception as e:
        print(str(e))
        return False


if __name__ == "__main__":
    mailto_list = ['xjh_cn@yeah.net']
    send(mailto_list, "Check Auto Email", "All is well."):
